snippet: The Rev. Al Sharpton, who has been honored by Mayor Bill de Blasio and President Obama, has regularly sidestepped taxes, rent and other bills.
abstract: Rev Al Sharpton, who has been honored by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and President Obama, has managed to avoid taxes, rent and other bills, and has more than $4.5 million in current state and federal tax liens against him and his for-profit businesses; he says he is paying both down, but his balance with state has grown in recent years; his National Action Network appears to have survived by not paying federal payroll taxes.
lead_paragraph: The Rev. Al Sharpton, who has been honored by Mayor Bill de Blasio and President Obama, has regularly sidestepped taxes, rent and other bills.

headline.main: As Sharpton Rose, So Did His Unpaid Taxes
headline.print_headline: As Sharpton Rose, So Did His Unpaid Taxes
